snippet: Yiu Mantin, who planned to publish a book condemning the Chinese Communist Party leader, Xi Jinping, was sentenced to 10 years for smuggling industrial chemicals.
abstract: Court in southern China sentences Hong Kong publisher Yiu Mantin to 10 years in prison for smuggling industrial chemicals; Yiu's family and supporters say charges are political vendetta brought on by his plans to publish a book condemning Chinese Communist Party leader Xi Jinping.
lead_paragraph: Yiu Mantin, who planned to publish a book condemning the Chinese Communist Party leader, Xi Jinping, was sentenced to 10 years for smuggling industrial chemicals.

headline.main: Hong Kong Publisher’s Prison Sentence Is Called a Political Vendetta
headline.print_headline: China: Hong Kong Publisher Planning Critical Book Is Sentenced in Smuggling
